nodes.bodyText: Since users.username and users.role were removed from the file the translations aren't found on the user create and user edit pages. So you will need to update those pages to use the new translation keys or add these two back to the messages file

nodes.bodyText: Use the border constant we have in the borders.js file.
Updated by moving to app.scss (like I asked you to do in your merge request)
This should also display a notification when it's been updated.
The table provides instant feedback by updating the status of the checkbox.  Nothing more is needed.
Shouldn't the user have to confirm the change in that case? I'm just thinking about if a user accidentally disables someones account and doesn't realize it as no feedback was provided
Because it is a simple task and easily undo-able, it does not need a confirmation.  Only complex tasks or ones that cannot be undone need confirmation.
